titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Provost's Office, Yale University, Records Concerning the Establishment of the Residential College System
Provost's Office, Yale University, Records Concerning the Establishment of the Residential College System
titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 11:21

did.unittitle: Provost's office, Yale University, records concerning the establishment of the residential college system

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of reports, personnel records, budgets, and subject files, maintained by Charles Seymour as provost, related to the establishment of the residential college system at Yale.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Office of the Provost

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 3-A (YRG 3-A), Records of the Yale provost"s office.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Provost"s Office, Yale University, Records Concerning the Establishment of the Residential College System (RU 38). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of reports, personnel records, budgets, and subject files, maintained by Charles Seymour as provost, related to the establishment of the residential college system at Yale.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged alphabetically by subject.
